sentences.sContent: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.sCn: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.sContent: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.sCn: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

sentences.sContent: ...Success authors usually serve up vivid stories about how exceptional businesspeople stamped their personalities on a company or rescued it from a life-threatening crisis...
...The vivid images of more than 300 animals that Jean-Marie Chauvet and his assistants found on the cave walls were like none that they had seen before...

phrases.pCn: 生动的描述；生动的报导
逼真模式；栩栩如生的描写

remMethod.val: viv(生命) ＋ id → 有生命力的 → 生动的

words.tran: 使生动；使活跃；给与生气

trans.tranCn: 鲜艳的； 生动的， 栩栩如生的
trans.tranOther: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real
